DOCNAME: CASE OF STORNELLI AND SACCHI v. ITALY
CONCLUSION: Preliminary objection rejected (non-exhaustion of domestic remedies);Violation of P1-1;Violation of Art. 6-1;Pecuniary damage - claim dismissed;Non-pecuniary damage - financial award;Costs and expenses partial award - domestic proceedings;Costs and expenses partial award - Convention proceedings
TEXT: CARDINAL . The applicants were respectively born in DATE , DATE , DATE and DATE and live in GPE .
CARDINAL . PERSON was the owner of a flat in GPE , which he had let to ORG and after her death to her daughter PERSON

CARDINAL . In a writ served on the tenant on DATE , PERSON informed the tenant that he intended to terminate the lease on expiry of the term on DATE and asked her to vacate the LOC by DATE . He summoned the tenant to appear before the Florence Magistrate .
CARDINAL . By a decision of CARDINAL DATE , which was made enforceable on DATE , the Florence Magistrate upheld the validity of the notice to quit and ordered that the premises be vacated by DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , GPE died , his wife and children – the actual applicants – inherited the flat and became party to the proceedings as heirs .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants served notice on the tenant requiring her to vacate the premises .
CARDINAL . On DATE , they informed the tenant that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on DATE .

CARDINAL . DATE and DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempts to recover possession . Each attempt proved unsuccessful , as the applicants were not entitled to police assistance in enforcing the order for possession .
CARDINAL . On DATE , pursuant to section CARDINAL of Law no . CARDINAL , the tenant asked for a suspension of the eviction proceedings .
CARDINAL . NORP The eviction proceedings were suspended until DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the applicants served notice on the tenant informing her that the order for possession would be enforced by a bailiff on CARDINAL DATE .
CARDINAL . On DATE , the bailiff made CARDINAL attempt and discovered that the tenant had left the LOC on DATE .
CARDINAL . Consequently , the applicants recovered possession of the flat .
CARDINAL . The relevant domestic law and practice is described in the ORG 's judgment in the case of ORG , ( no . CARDINAL/CARDINAL , § § DATE ) .
